data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1921 was awarded to Albert Einstein "for his services to Theoretical Physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the photoelectric effect"
data.text:
Albert Einstein

Documentary

At a dinner at the Savoy Hotel, London, England, on 27 October 1930, the author George Bernard Shaw paid tribute to Professor Albert Einstein in an after-dinner speech.*

Credit: ITN Archive/Reuters

* The event is described in a book by Abraham Pais, Einstein Lived Here (page 181), published by Clarendon Press in 1994.
